data.event: The population was 21,929 at the 2010 census and ranked 35th on the list of highest-income places with a population of at least 10,000.
Acton became an incorporated town in 1735.

event.title: was named a Blue Ribbon School by the U.S. Department of Education in 2009

data.event: The local high school, Acton-Boxborough Regional High School, was named a Blue Ribbon School by the U.S. Department of Education in 2009.
In 2012, U.S. News & World Report ranked Acton-Boxborough #3 among open enrollment high schools and #7 overall for STEM education in the United States.[6]
